page.title: Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

revision.text:
{{For|the two-part premiere of the 2012–2017 animated Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles TV series|Rise of the Turtles}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2015}} {{Infobox television | show_name = Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles | image = Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles - Logo.png | image_size = | caption = | genre = {{Plainlist| * [[Action (genre)|Action]]-[[Comedy]] * [[Science fantasy]] * [[Superhero fiction|Superhero]] * [[Martial arts (genre)|Martial arts]] }} | based_on = [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]]
by [[Kevin Eastman]]
[[Peter Laird]] | developer = Andy Suriano
Ant Ward | voices = {{plainlist | * [[Omar Benson Miller]] * [[Ben Schwartz]] * [[Josh Brener]] * [[Brandon Mychal Smith]] * [[Kat Graham]] * [[Eric Bauza]] }} | theme_music_composer = [[Matt Mahaffey]]
Leticia Wolf | opentheme = "Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" by [[Matt Mahaffey]] | endtheme = "Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" (instrumental) | composer = Matt Mahaffey | country = United States | language = English | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 26 (52 segments) | runtime = 11 minutes
22 minutes (specials) | list_episodes = | executive_producer = {{plainlist | * Andy Suriano * Ant Ward }} | producer = Vladimir Radev | company = [[Nickelodeon Animation Studio]]
[[Mirage Studios]]
[[Flying Bark Productions]]
{{small|(animation)}} | network = [[Nickelodeon]] | distributor = [[Viacom Media Networks]] | picture_format = [[HDTV|HDTV 1080i]] | audio_format = [[Dolby Digital|Dolby Digital 5.1]] | first_aired = {{start date|2018|9|17}} | last_aired = {{end date|present}} | preceded_by = [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2012 TV series)|''Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles'' (2012 TV series)]] | followed_by = | website = http://www.nick.com/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles/ }} '''''Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles''''' is an American [[traditional animation|2D-animated]] [[television series]] based on the fictional superhero team the [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]]. The series debuted on September 17, 2018 after a sneak preview aired on July 20.{{cite web|url=http://www.teenagemutantninjaturtles.com/2018/01/01/rob-paulsen-release-rise-tmnt/|title=Rob Paulsen Reveals Release Date for Rise of the TMNT|publisher=Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|language=English|author=Justin Wren|date=1 January 2018|accessdate=2 January 2018}} The first 5 episodes of the series were released online the same day. The series was announced by [[Nickelodeon]] in a [[press release]] on March 2, 2017 and is initially scheduled to run for at least 26 episodes{{cite web|title=Nickelodeon Reimagines the Iconic Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles in All-New Animated Series, Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20170302006308/en/Nickelodeon-Reimagines-Iconic-Teenage-Mutant-Ninja-Turtles|website=Business Wire|publisher=Nickelodeon Group|accessdate=13 March 2017}}. This re-imagined series will have the Turtles go on new adventures as they seek to unlock the mystical secrets of [[New York City]]{{cite web|last1=Petski|first1=Denise|title=‘Rise of The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles’: Ben Schwartz, Kat Graham Among Voice Cast|url=http://deadline.com/2017/11/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-ben-schwartz-kat-graham-voice-cast-1202200190/|website=Deadline|publisher=Penske Media Corporation|accessdate=4 November 2017}}. On July 27, 2018, Nickelodeon renewed the series for a second season consisting of 26 episodes prior to the official debut of the first season.{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2018/07/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-five-series-renewed-nickelodeon-tca-1202435033/|title=‘Rise Of The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles’ Among Five Series Renewed By Nickelodeon – TCA|last=Petski|first=Denise|publisher=Deadline|date=July 27, 2018|accessdate=July 28, 2018}} ==Plot== Deep in the [[New York City water supply system|sewers of New York City]], [[Leonardo (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)|Leonardo]], [[Raphael (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)|Raphael]], [[Donatello (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)|Donatello]], and [[Michelangelo (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)|Michelangelo]] are four mutant turtle brothers in their early teens who go on new adventures where they end up "tapping into mystic ninja powers they never knew existed", while "learning" to work together as a team and navigate the perils of the modern age and hidden realms in order to fulfill their destiny to become a team of heroes". ==Characters== {{main|List of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles characters}} ===Ninja Turtles=== * '''[[Raphael (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)|Raphael]]''' (voiced by [[Omar Benson Miller]]) – A [[common snapping turtle]] who is the "oldest, physically the biggest and strongest brother." In this show, he is the leader of the Ninja Turtles team. He often acts before he thinks which often gets the other turtles in trouble.{{cite web|url=http://www.teenagemutantninjaturtles.com/2017/11/02/rise-tmnt-raph-new-leader/|title=Information About Rise of the TMNT Reveals Raph is the New Leader|publisher=Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|language=English|author= Justin Wren|date=2 November 2017|accessdate=8 February 2018}} Raph originally used two sais, but later wields two [[tonfa]] in battle that can amplify his own strength with red energy.{{cite news|url=http://comicbook.com/tv-shows/2018/02/01/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-art-revealed/|title=First Look at Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Revealed|publisher=Comicbook|language=English|author=Matthew Mueller|date=1 February 2018|accessdate=2 February 2018}} In "Mascot Melee," it is revealed that Raphael is allergic to peanut butter. * '''[[Donatello (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)|Donatello]]''' (voiced by [[Josh Brener]]) – A [[Trionychidae|softshell turtle]] who is the "genius of the team." He has a sidekick drone named Sheldon along with many other battle shells that he makes in order to help him in battle because of his species. He wields a high-tech [[bō|bō (staff)]] in battle that can transform into a multitude of weapons like drills or a rocket powered hammer.{{cite news|url=http://comicbook.com/tv-shows/2018/02/01/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-art-revealed/|title=First Look at Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Revealed|publisher=Comicbook|language=English|author=Matthew Mueller|date=1 February 2018|accessdate=2 February 2018}} In "Mascot Melee," it was revealed Donnie has a crush on a comic book heroine called Atomic Lass. In "Stuck on You", Donnie reveals his computer password is "Bootyyyshaker9000" due to his love of dancing. * '''[[Leonardo (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)|Leonardo]]''' (voiced by [[Ben Schwartz]]{{cite web|title=Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles voice cast announced|url=http://www.superherohype.com/news/407163-rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-voice-cast-announced|website=Super Hero Hype|date=2 November 2017|accessdate=2 November 2017}}) – A [[red-eared slider]] who is the "self-proclaimed 'coolest' brother." He is also known to be called the "trickster", and he thinks that his one liners will "fire up the team". Leo originally used two ninjatos, but later wields an [[ōdachi|ōdachi sword]] in battle that can open portals.{{cite news|url=http://www.bigshinyrobot.com/60258/first-look-nickelodeons-rise-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles/|title=First Look at Nickelodeon's 'Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles'|publisher=Big Shiny Robots|language=English|author=Newerbot|date=1 February 2018|accessdate=3 February 2018}} * '''[[Michelangelo (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)|Michelangelo]]''' (voiced by [[Brandon Mychal Smith]]) – A [[box turtle]] who is the "youngest jokester, prankster brother." In this show, he appears as a preteen. He is an artist, and is also called the "wild card." Mikey originally used a pair of nunchucks, but later wields a [[kusari-fundo]] in battle that can become a fire spirit.{{cite news|url=https://www.cbr.com/rise-teenage-mutant-ninja-turles-image/|title=Ninja Turtles Get a Major Makeover in First Rise of the TMNT Image|publisher=CBR|language=English|author=Justin Carter|date=1 February 2018|accessdate=3 February 2018}} In "Donnie's Gifts" and "The Longest Fight," it is revealed that Mikey also have a passion of cooking including making pizza. ===Supporting=== * '''[[April O'Neil]]''' (voiced by [[Kat Graham]]) – A human friend of the Ninja Turtles. In this series, April is an African-American fun-loving party girl with glasses who is constantly looking for a job to support herself which always goes wrong. When fighting, she also wields a [[baseball bat]].{{cite web|url=http://www.teenagemutantninjaturtles.com/2018/02/06/20-rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles/|title=0 Shellraising Details About Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|publisher=Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|language=English|author=Justin Wren|date=6 February 2018|accessdate=8 February 2018}} ** '''Mayhem''' – April O'Neil's pet cat/dog-like creature with short-range teleportation abilities.{{cite news|url=https://www.kotaku.com.au/2018/02/here-are-the-new-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtlesas-well-as-the-african-american-april-oneil/|title=Here are the New Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, as Well As The African American April O'Neil|publisher=Kotaku|language=English|author=James Whitbrook|date=2 February 2018|accessdate=3 February 2018}} It is an agent that worked against Baron Draxum. * '''[[Splinter (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)|Splinter]]''' (voiced by [[Eric Bauza]]) – A mutant gray rat who is the Ninja Turtles' sensei and adoptive father. He does not start training the turtles seriously until threats about Baron Draxum are discovered. ===Antagonists=== * '''Baron Draxum''' (voiced by [[John Cena]]{{cite web|title=John Cena Joins Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|url=https://www.newsarama.com/38148-john-cena-joins-rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles.html|website=Newsarama|date=11 January 2018|accessdate=11 January 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/john-cena-voice-ninja-turtles-character-produce-competition-series-nickelodeon-1073610|title=John Cena to Voice 'Ninja Turtles' Character, Produce Competition Series for Nickelodeon|publisher=Hollywood Reporter|language=English|author=Kimberly Nordyke|date=11 January 2018|accessdate=11 January 2018}}) – A turquoise-skinned [[Yōkai]] warrior and alchemist from the "Hidden City" with maroon hair and [[faun]]-like legs, who has the power to augment his own body by crushing pods in his hands. As the self-proclaimed protector of all mutantkind, Baron Draxum seeks to mutate humans into mutants so that he can live up to his title.{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/tv/news/928203-meet-baron-draxum-john-cenas-villain-from-rise-of-the-tmnt|title=Meet Baron Draxum, John Cena’s Villain from Rise of the TMNT|publisher=Coming Soon|language=English|author=Spencer Perry|date=6 March 2018|accessdate=8 May 2018}} An incident amidst an earlier attempt to mutate humankind into Yōkai led to the creation of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and their master Splinter. ** '''Hunginn and Muninn''' (voiced by [[Timothy Simons|Tim Simons]] and [[Sam Richardson (actor)|Sam Richardson]][http://ew.com/tv/2018/07/19/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-trailer/]) – Two small [[gargoyle]]-like creatures that are often seen sitting on Baron Draxum's shoulders. Their name and presence as Draxum's constant companions are a play on the Norse saga ravens [[Huginn and Muninn]]. ** '''Guardsmen''' (voiced by [[Fred Tatasciore]]) – The guards that work for Baron Draxum who are experts at armed combat. They can also ride monstrous dogs. * '''Oozesquitos''' – A swarm of mutant mosquitoes that are often used for Baron Draxum.{{cite web|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2018/03/08/8573398.aspx|title=First Look at John Cena's Baron Draxum|publisher=Gameinformer|language=English|author=Jon Bowman|date=7 March 2018|accessdate=2 April 2018}} They store mutagen in them in order to infect anyone they bite which turns them into mutants. The Oozesquitoes are first seen when Baron Draxum tests the mutagen on a delivery guy named Stewart. In the Ninja Turtles first encounter with Baron Draxum, the Ninja Turtles unknowingly unleash the Oozesquitos into New York City. In "Bug Busters," it is revealed that Big Mama uses the Oozesquitos so that they can fight for her entertainment in the Battle Nexus much to the annoyance of Baron Draxum. In addition, he also had a hand in the Ninja Turtles' origins. As Baron Draxum called them his swarm, Hunginn and Muninn stated that the Turtles called them Oozesquitoes which is catchy to them. * '''[[Foot Clan]]''' – In this series, the Foot Clan work for Baron Draxum as hired mercenaries. They can make origami ninjas out of paper and have the power of teleportation through hidden gateways. ** '''Foot Lieutenant''' (voiced by [[Rob Paulsen]]) – The lieutenant of the Foot Clan who speaks in a wheezy voice. ** '''Foot Brute''' (voiced by [[Maurice LaMarche]]) – A buff member of the Foot Clan that works alongside the Foot Lieutenant. ** '''Origami Ninjas''' – Ninjas made out of paper that are created by the Foot Lieutenant and the Foot Brute. * '''Mutant [[Silverfish]]''' – A bunch of mutant silverfish. If they are attacked, the Mutant Silverfish will split into smaller silverfish that would later aggregate back to its original state. * '''Meat Sweats''' (voiced by [[John Lydon|Johnny Rotten]][http://ew.com/tv/2018/07/19/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-trailer/]) – Rupert Swaggart is a former [[celebrity chef]] who was turned into a mutant pig upon being stung by an Oozesquito while hitting a failing contestant with a slab of pig meat during his TV show "Kondescending Kitchen". He wears gray gloves to conceal his tendril arms, which he uses to temporary absorb the abilities of any other mutants, whom he habitually makes into his "meals" to strengthen the "flavor."{{citeweb|url=https://www.bleedingcool.com/2018/02/17/new-york-toy-fair-rise-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-figures-debut-playmates/|title=New York Toy Fair: Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Figures Debut From Playmates|publisher=BleedingCool|date=February 20, 2018|accessdate=March 27, 2018}} * '''Albearto''' (voiced by [[Tom Kenny]][http://ew.com/tv/2018/07/19/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-trailer/] impersonating [[Ed Wynn]]) – An animatronic bear used at children's birthday parties in Albearto's Pizzeria. After a small child short-circuited him, April had Donatello upgrade him where a stage mishap caused Albearto to get electrocuted and come to life. In "Al Be Back," Albearto returns where his head was salvaged by Baxter Stockboy in exchange for the cheat codes for the dance game. While on a car, he places his head on a new Albearto body in front of the birthday kids, gets the manager's hand print for the security scanner, and animates his bear "brothers" from failed franchises to attack Albearto Land where Albearto also animated the Albearto animatronics there. The Ninja Turtles put on a concert that Albearto and his animatronic "brothers" attend which causes them to explode since they couldn't stand the Ninja Turtles' singing. ** '''Cheery Tomato''' (voiced by [[Jill Talley]]) – An animatronic anthropomorphic tomato at Albearto's Pizzeria brought to life by Alberto. ** '''President Pepperoni''' (voiced by Eric Bauza) – An animatronic anthropomorphic pepperoni at Albearto's Pizzeria brought to life by Alberto. ** '''Al-Beardo the Pirate''' (voiced by Tom Kenny in a pirate accent) - An animatronic bear pirate with a hook for a right hand, an eyepatch over his right eye, and a left peg leg who is the mascot of a failed Albearto's Pizzeria franchise called "Al-Beardo's Squid and Chips." He puts the "arr in tartar sauce." ** '''Bayou 'Bearto''' (voiced by Tom Kenny in a Southern accent) - An animatronic bear hillbilly who is the mascot of a failed unnamed Albearto's Pizzeria franchise where Albearto stated that his "gumbo was jumbo." ** '''Chef Albéar''' (voiced by Tom Kenny in French accent) - An animatronic bear who is the mascot of a failed Albearto's Pizzeria franchise called La Petite Albear. ** '''Otto von Bearto''' (voiced by Tom Kenny in a German accent) - An animatronic bear who is the mascot of a failed Albearto's Pizzeria franchise called "Otto von Bearto's Best Wurst House." * '''Warren Stone''' (voiced by [[John Michael Higgins]][http://ew.com/tv/2018/07/19/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-trailer/]) – A semi-successful and narcissistic news anchor who mutated into a small mutant earthworm with an earthworm tail instead of legs after being stung by an Oozesquito.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2018/film/festivals/nickelodeon-rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-annecy-1202845826/|title=Nickelodeon's 'Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles' Gets Annecy First Look|publisher=Variety|language=English|author=Jamie Lang|date=13 June 2018|accessdate=15 June 2018}} If cut in half, Warren can regenerate. Since his mutation, he self-declared himself the greatest foe of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. * '''Hypno-Potamus''' (voiced by [[Rhys Darby]][http://ew.com/tv/2018/07/19/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-trailer/]) – Mezmer-ron is a successful stage magician and hypnotist who mutated into a hippopotamus after he was stung by an Oozesquito that merged him with his pet hippopotamus Doug. Driven by envy, Hypno-Potamus strives to outachieve any magician with an even greater "trick" than they can produce, and find a way to bring Doug back to life, leading to his clashes with the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. * '''Repo Mantis''' (voiced by [[Fred Tatasciore]][http://ew.com/tv/2018/07/19/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-trailer/]) – The vicious, treacherous and greedy owner of a [[Wrecking yard|salvage yard]] called Repo Mantis Salvage who was mutated into a purple mutant mantis after being stung by an Oozesquito. * '''Ghostbear''' (voiced by [[Jorge Gutierrez (animator)|Jorge Gutierrez]][http://ew.com/tv/2018/07/19/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-trailer/]) – A human wrestling champion who cheats. Raphael was a fan of him until he learned the truth about his fighting techniques. * '''Mutant Cockroach Gang''' - An unnamed group of mutant cockroaches that posed as mascots. ** '''Atomic Lass''' (voiced by [[Grey DeLisle|Grey Griffin]]) - An unnamed mutant cockroach dressed as Atomic Lass. ** '''Joey the Junkyard Dog''' (voiced by [[John DiMaggio]]) - An unnamed mutant cockroach dressed as Joey the Junkyard Dog. ** '''Robot Vampire''' (voiced by Grey Griffin) - An unnamed mutant cockroach dressed as Robot Vampire. ** '''Sergeant Woodpecker''' (voiced by Eric Bauza) - An unnamed mutant cockroach dressed as Sergeant Woodpecker. * '''Baxter Stockboy''' (voiced by Ramone Hamilton) - An unpaid stockboy and self-proclaimed "internet celebrity" who is loosely based on [[Baxter Stockman]]. He built a robot to pass off as the Gumbus to haunt the supermarket that he worked at. * '''Mrs. Cuddles''' (voiced by [[Eliza Schneider|Eliza Jane Schneider]]) - A plush rabbit character from the TV series of the same name who comes to life to feeds on fear of her to become bigger and stronger. If someone laughs at her, Mrs. Cuddles loses her size and strength. * '''Big Mama''' (voiced by [[Lena Headey]][http://ew.com/tv/2018/07/19/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-trailer/]) – A [[Jorōgumo]] who can change between her human form and her humanoid spider form. She is the owner of an extradimensional gladiator arena called the Battle Nexus which is hidden in the secret sub-level of a hotel that is owned by her human form. Big Mama uses the Oozesquitos in her possession to mutate anyone into mutants so that they can fight for her entertainment in the Battle Nexus. Her plot has brought her into conflict with Baron Draxum who felt that Big Mama was misusing the Oozesquitos. ** '''Gus''' (voiced by [[Fred Tatasciore]]) - A mutant bulldog that is loyal to Big Mama. ===Other characters=== * '''Stewart''' (voiced by [[Fred Tatasciore]]) - Stewart is a food delivery man who unknowingly followed Baron Draxum's minions into the Hidden City which led to Baron Draxum using the Oozesquito to turn a delivery person named Stewart into a mutant [[Whitefish (fisheries term)|whitefish]] and runs off. He did mention before his mutation that whitefish was used to imitate the crab meat that his employers serve. In "Bug Busters," Stewart was seen fighting in the Battle Nexus where he engaged an octopus elevator operator in a slap fight. * '''Todd Capybara''' (voiced by [[Thurop Van Orman]]) – A friendly mutant [[capybara]] and selfless charitable caretaker of Cuddles Cakes Puppy Rescue on [[Long Island]]. In exchange for Todd giving up his RV, Michelangelo and Donatello build a new type of residence for Todd and his rescue puppies. * '''Señor Hueso''' (voiced by [[Eric Bauza]] impersonating [[Ricardo Montalbán]]) - A [[Skeleton (undead)|skeleton]] who uses his own left arm for a cane. He is the doorman of the [[List of pizza chains|pizza parlor]] called World's Greatest Pizza in New York's mystical Undercity. Señor Hueso's name is Spanish for "Mr. Bone." ==Production== On March 2, 2017, ''Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles'' was announced as a new re-imagining of the ''Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles'' franchise. [[Cyma Zarghami]], president of the [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon Group]], stated in a press release:
"The Turtles is a property that has reinvention in its DNA, which keeps it fresh and relevant to every new generation while satisfying the demand from its adult fans. 'Turtles' has been an incredibly important franchise for us since we reignited it five years ago, and we’re excited for the new series to take the characters in a different direction with more humor, a younger and lighter feel and all-new dimensions to explore."
The series logotype was revealed to public in mid-October 2017.{{cite web|url=http://www.teenagemutantninjaturtles.com/2017/10/16/first-look-rise-tmnt-logo/|title=First Look at Rise of the TMNT Logo from BLE 2017|publisher=Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|language=English|author=Justin Wren|date=16 October 2017|accessdate=5 November 2017}} On November 2, 2017, Nickelodeon announced the official voice actor cast for the main characters on the turtles' side. In addition to these news, voice actor [[Rob Paulsen]], who previously voiced Raphael in the [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987 TV series)|1987–1996 TV series]] as well as Donatello in the [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2012 TV series)|2012–2017 TV series]], will now serve as the voice director for this TV series. John Cena was later cast as the villain Baron Draxum.{{cite web|url=http://www.teenagemutantninjaturtles.com/2018/01/11/john-cena-rise-tmnt/|title=John Cena will voice new villain in Rise of the TMNT|publisher=Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|language=English|author=Justin Wren|date=12 January 2018|accessdate=13 January 2018}} Besides voice directing, Rob Paulsen will also be providing voice work alongside fellow voice actor [[Maurice LaMarche]].[http://nickalive.blogspot.com/2017/12/voice-acting-legend-rob-paulsen-talks.html Nick Alive 30 December 2017 – ''Voice Acting Legend Rob Paulsen Talks About Moving Into Directing for 'Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles''] On February 1, 2018, major main-characters art designs were announced and revealed by Nickelodeon.{{cite news|url=http://ew.com/tv/rise-of-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles|title=Meet the first African-American April in Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles first look|publisher=Entertainment Weekly|language=English|author=Dan Snierson|date=1 February 2018|accessdate=1 February 2018}} This occurred during a [[Facebook]] event, which was broadcast live that day.{{cite news|url=http://www.teenagemutantninjaturtles.com/2018/02/01/rise-of-the-tmnt-character-art-revealed/|title=Rise of the TMNT Character Art Officially Revealed|publisher=Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|language=English|author=Justin Wren|date=1 February 2018|accessdate=3 February 2018}} On March 23, 2018, the first trailer for the series was released by Nickelodeon.{{cite web|url=http://www.syfy.com/syfywire/cowabunga-watch-the-first-trailer-for-nicks-rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles|title=Cowabunga, Watch the first Trailer for Nick's Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|publisher=Syfy Wyre|language=English|author=Josh Weiss|date=23 March 2018|accessdate=24 March 2018}} In mid-May 2018, it was announced that each episode will consist of two 11-minute carts. Each of them will tell self-contained, standalone stories with hints of a larger plot.{{cite web|url=http://nickalive.blogspot.se/2018/02/nickelodeon-to-premiere-rise-of-tthe.html|title=Nickelodeon To Premiere 'Rise Of The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles' During Mid-September 2018; To Launch 'Rise Of The TMNT' Toy Line In The Run Up To Christmas|publisher=Nickelodeon|language=English|date=13 May 2018|accessdate=14 May 2018}} On June 26, 2018, the series intro theme song was released by Nickelodeon.{{cite web|url=http://www.denofgeek.com/us/tv/teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles/262601/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-show-opener-revealed|title=Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Show Opener Revealed|publisher=Den of Geek|language=English|author=Mike Cecchini|date=26 June 2018|accessdate=26 June 2018}} On July 20, 2018, the show aired as a sneak peek after the [[2018 Kids' Choice Sports Awards]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.cbr.com/sdcc-rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-trailer/|title=SDCC: Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Gets a New Trailer|date=2018-07-19|work=CBR|access-date=2018-08-31|language=en-US}} On September 17, 2018, the show premiered on Nickelodeon.{{Cite news|url=https://www.syfy.com/syfywire/tca-2018-rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-renewed-for-season-2-before-series|title=TCA 2018: Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles renewed for Season 2 before series premiere in the fall|last=Weiss|first=Josh|date=2018-07-27|work=Syfy|access-date=2018-08-31|language=en}} ==Episodes== ===Season 1 (2018-19)=== {{Episode table | background=#5CA673 | overall= | season= | title= | writer= | writerT=Directed by | aux2= | aux2T=Written by | airdate= | viewers= | country=US | episodes= {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 1 |EpisodeNumber2 = 1 |Title = Mystic Mayhem |WrittenBy = Brendan Clogher & Sebastian Montes |Aux2 = Ian Busch, Russ Carney,
Ron Corcillo, & Jesse Gordon |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|7|20}} |Viewers = 0.60http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-friday-cable-originals-network-finals-7-20-2018.html |ShortSummary = The Turtles discover that they are not the only weirdest things in New York when they encounter two villains from the Hidden City pursuing a dog-like agent. They have their first encounter with Baron Draxum, who is making mutants with the help of his Oozesquitos. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 2a |EpisodeNumber2 = 2a |Title = Origami Tsunami |WrittenBy = Jamie Vickers |Aux2 = Russ Carney & Ron Corcillo |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|9|25}} |Viewers = 0.86//www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-tuesday-cable-originals-network-finals-9-25-2018.html |ShortSummary = Longing for the excitements of hero life, Leo talks the team into tracking down the paper thief duo currently stalking the city. In doing so, the Turtles run into the Foot Clan, who use their mystic ability to create origami warriors from the stolen paper. *'''Note:''' [[YTV (TV channel)|YTV]] aired on September 21, 2018. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 2b |EpisodeNumber2 = 2b |Title = Donnie's Gifts |WrittenBy = Sebastian Montes |Aux2 = Russ Carney & Ron Corcillo |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|9|17}} |Viewers = 0.65http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-monday-cable-originals-network-finals-9-17-2018.html |ShortSummary = Donnie creates new gear for his brothers in order for them to overcome their bad habits. However, the gear only becomes a nuisance as they fight mutated chef dubbed Meat Sweats, who plans to cook the turtles in order to gain their powers. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 3a |EpisodeNumber2 = 3a |Title = War and Pizza |WrittenBy = Brendan Clogher |Aux2 = Ian Busch |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|9|17}} |Viewers = 0.65http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-monday-cable-originals-network-finals-9-17-2018.html |ShortSummary = In order to save April's job as a party captain at Albearto's Pizzeria, Donnie upgrades the main animatronic of Albearto, only for it to go out of control. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 3b |EpisodeNumber2 = 3b |Title = Newsworthy |WrittenBy = Sebastian Montes |Aux2 = Jesse Gordon |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|9|27}} |Viewers = 0.98http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-thursday-cable-originals-network-finals-9-27-2018.html |ShortSummary = To prove himself as the greatest enemy of the Turtles, former news anchor-turned-mutant earthworm Warren Stone gets in the way of the Turtles as they track down Hypno-Potamus, who is abducting the animal partners of other magicians. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 4a |EpisodeNumber2 = 4a |Title = Repo Mantis |WrittenBy = Jamie Vickers |Aux2 = Russ Carney & Ron Corcillo |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|9|20}} |Viewers = 1.02http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-thursday-cable-originals-network-finals-9-20-2018.html |ShortSummary = Mikey and Donnie try to get a ''Jupiter Jim'' moon buggy vehicle from a repo yard, where they run afoul of its owner Repo Mantis. In exchange for the prop vehicle, Mikey and Donnie are hired as repo men and are sent to repossess an RV on [[Long Island]]. However, the deal deteriorates when they meet the RV's possessor, a kind mutant named Todd Capybara, and his puppies. *'''Note''': This episode is later referenced in Hypno! Part Deux when April contacts Donatello...... Also explaining where the two other brothers were doing for their whole day. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 4b |EpisodeNumber2 = 4b |Title = Down With the Sickness |WrittenBy = Jamie Vickers |Aux2 = Jesse Gordon |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|9|18}} |Viewers = 0.97http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-tuesday-cable-originals-network-finals-9-18-2018.html |ShortSummary = Splinter has come down with the rat flu, and the Turtles must deal with its 7 different stages involving fever, "wild rat man," "Captain Cuddle Cake," ninja supreme, karaoke love songs, and fan fiction. The Turtles hope that Splinter will make to the final stage called "Must Say Yes" so that they can ask him for whatever they want. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 5a |EpisodeNumber2 = 5a |Title = The Fast and the Furriest |WrittenBy = Brendan Clogher |Aux2 = Russ Carney & Ron Corcillo |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|9|24}} |Viewers = 0.90http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-monday-cable-originals-network-finals-9-24-2018.html |ShortSummary = When Donnie's newly-built Turtle Tank goes missing, he and the Turtles must find it. While going after some usual suspects, they are unaware that the Turtle Tank was taken by Splinter, who is additionally invited to "dinner" with Meat Sweats. *'''Note''': This episode's broadcast is not in line with the actual plot continuity, because the Turtles visit a certain location in the Undercity in the later episode "Minotaur Maze" for the first time, while in this episode (which was aired beforehand) they are already familiar with its location. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 5b |EpisodeNumber2 = 5b |Title = Mascot Melee |WrittenBy = Sebastian Montes |Aux2 = Ian Busch |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|9|26}} |Viewers = 0.92http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-wednesday-cable-originals-network-finals-9-26-2018.html |ShortSummary = While looking for a new robe for Splinter, the Turtles traverse through [[Times Square]], where they fight the mascots lurking there who get jealous of Raphael's "Turtlepotamus" meme. When they take the money that Raphael has made, the other Turtles suit up and take action against the mascot - until they discover the true identity of the mascots as mutant cockroaches. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 6a |EpisodeNumber2 = 6a |Title = Shell in a Cell |WrittenBy = Sebastian Montes |Aux2 = Dale Malinowski |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|9|19}} |Viewers = 0.83http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-wednesday-cable-originals-network-finals-9-19-2018.html |ShortSummary = Leo unseats Raph's wrestling idol Ghostbear from his title as the champion of the world after accidentally falling on him from the rafters. Raph soon becomes irked by Leo's cockiness and decides to wrestle him himself. When Ghostbear joins the fight, Raph learns that Ghostbear doesn't play by the rules. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 6b |EpisodeNumber2 = 6b |Title = Minotaur Maze |DirectedBy = Brendan Clogher |WrittenBy = Jesse Gordon |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|10|6}} |Viewers = 1.02http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-saturday-cable-originals-network-finals-10-6-2018.html |ShortSummary = After the Turtles stumble across a pizza restaurant in the mystical Undercity while following a Fire Yōkai, Leonardo drags his brothers into a pizza-shaped Maze of Death to obtain the ultimate prize....a free helping to the titular parlor's "world's greatest pizza." But in order to claim it, they will have to contend with the pizza's guardian in the form of the Minotaur who is the maze's assistant manager. *'''Note''': This episode actually takes place before "The Fast and the Furriest" (''see above''). |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 7 |EpisodeNumber2 = 7 |Title = Bug Busters |DirectedBy = Abe Audish, Brendan Clogher, & Jamie Vickers |WrittenBy = Ian Busch, Russ Carney, Ron Corcillo, & Jesse Gordon |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|11|17}} |Viewers = 0.95http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-saturday-cable-originals-network-finals-11-17-2018.html |ShortSummary = The Turtles look for a way to eliminate New York City's Oozesquito problem before more mutants are made. Though this plot brings them into conflict with Big Mama in her plot to make mutants to fight for her entertainment in the Battle Nexus in addition to Baron Draxum finding out about the misuse of the Oozesquitoes. '''Note''': During the conversation between Baron Draxum and Big Mama on the handling of mutants and Oozesquitoes, the designs for this show's versions of Rocksteady, Bebop, Leatherhead, Halfcourt, and a mutant shark that might be Armaggon are shown. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 8a |EpisodeNumber2 = 8a |Title = The Longest Fight |DirectedBy = Sebastian Montes |WrittenBy = Ian Busch |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|10|6}} |Viewers = 1.02http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-saturday-cable-originals-network-finals-10-6-2018.html |ShortSummary = The Turtles have a hard time watching their skateboarding idol Sydney Allen on the "Extreme Skateboarding Finals" and stopping a burglary at Gilbert's Department Store conducted by the Foot Clan at the same time. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 8b |EpisodeNumber2 = 8b |Title = Hypno! Part Deux! |RTitle = |DirectedBy = Jamie Vickers |WrittenBy = Jesse Gordon |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|11|3}} |Viewers = 0.99http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-saturday-cable-originals-network-finals-11-3-2018.html |ShortSummary = Hypno-Potamus returns and causes havoc at April's homecoming dance. *'''Note''': This episode is not in chronological order. It runs simultaneously with Repo Mantis. As evidenced by the dogs barking in the background of Donatello's and April's phone conversation. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 9a |EpisodeNumber2 = 9a |Title = The Gumbus |DirectedBy = Sebastian Montes |WrittenBy = Russ Carney & Ron Corcillo |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|10|13}} |Viewers = 1.09http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-saturday-cable-originals-network-finals-10-13-2018.html |ShortSummary = Leo, Mikey and April investigate a mysterious specter haunting a themed supermarket called ''Stock 'n Shop'', which leads to their encounter with Baxter Stockboy. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 9b |EpisodeNumber2 = 9b |Title = Mrs. Cuddles |DirectedBy = Abe Audish & Jamie Vickers |WrittenBy = Ian Busch |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|10|20}} |Viewers = 0.94http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-saturday-cable-originals-network-finals-10-20-2018.html |ShortSummary = April and the brothers make Raph face his greatest fear: an adorable kids' TV show rabbit named Mrs. Cuddles. However, things aren't so funny anymore when Mrs. Cuddles suddenly comes to life and begins hunting the Turtle family to feed on their fears. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 10a |EpisodeNumber2 = 10a |Title = Stuck on You |DirectedBy = Brendan Clogher |WrittenBy = Jesse Gordon |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|11|10}} |Viewers = 1.20http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-saturday-cable-originals-network-finals-11-10-2018.html |ShortSummary = After an unfortunate glue accident, the Turtles have to fight a whole host of villains like the Mutant Silverfish, the Foot Clan, Hypno-Potamus, and Warren Stone. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 10b |EpisodeNumber2 = 10b |Title = Al Be Back |DirectedBy = Brendan Clogher |WrittenBy = F.M. De Marco |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2018|12|1}} |Viewers = |ShortSummary = The Turtles plan their first public musical gig at Albearto Land. When it happens, it gets crashed by Albearto and his army of animatronic bears from failed Albearto's Pizza franchises. |LineColor = 5CA673 }} }} ==Broadcast== The series premiered on [[Nickelodeon]] in the [[United States]] on September 17, 2018. The series premiered as a sneak preview on [[YTV (TV channel)|YTV]] in [[Canada]] on July 27 the same year and was premiered officially on September 21 that year, In the [[United Kingdom|UK]], The show airs on [[Nicktoons (UK and Ireland)|Nicktoons]] and [[Channel 5 (UK)|Channel 5]]. ==Merchandise== ===Comics=== In April 2018, it was announced that [[IDW Publishing|IDW]] would publish a [[comic book]] based on the series, beginning in July 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.teenagemutantninjaturtles.com/2018/04/10/new-comic-series-based-on-rise-of-the-tmnt/|title=New Comic Series Based on Rise of the TMNT|publisher=Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|language=English|author=Dan Gehen|date=10 April 2018|accessdate=11 April 2018}} ===Toys=== On February 16, 2018, the first [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles action figures|toys based on the series]] were presented during the [[New York City Toy Fair]].{{cite web|url=http://collider.com/rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-toys/|title=‘Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles’ Toyline Unveiled Ahead of Toy Fair|publisher=Collider|language=English|author=Dave Trumbore|date=16 February 2018|accessdate=16 February 2018}} The first ''Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles'' toys are expected to be released on October 1, 2018, but are starting to leak out on store shelves on September 20, 2018.{{cite news|url=https://thewhitefootsoldier.com/rise-of-the-tmnt-figures-get-a-release-date/|title=Rise of the TMNT Figures Release Date Announced|publisher=White Foot Soldier|language=English|author=Master Splinter|date=18 February 2018|accessdate=24 February 2018}} In August 2018, the American fast food chain [[Sonic Drive-In]] released a set of kids meal toys based on the series, which were available in their Wacky Pack meals. ===Video game=== During the months leading up to the series' launch, [[Viacom]] and [[Nintendo]] collaborated to market ''Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles'' via a special limited-time online multiplayer event for the 2017 video game ''[[Splatoon 2]]'', in which Inklings can participate in a Splatfest tournament, battling over which of the four brothers is the best. Donatello won overall, beating Mikey in the first round, and Raphael (who had in turn beat Leonardo) in the finals.{{cite web|last1=Hall|first1=Charlie|title=Splatoon 2’s new Splatfest is Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles-themed|url=https://www.polygon.com/2018/4/26/17284520/splatoon-2-splatfest-date-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles|website=Polygon|accessdate=19 May 2018|date=26 April 2018}}{{cite web|title=A tournament-style Splatfest is coming|url=https://splatoon.nintendo.com/news-video/splatfest-tmnt-tournament/|website=Splatoon 2 Official Website|publisher=Nintendo|accessdate=19 May 2018}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{wikiquote-inline|Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles}} * {{IMDb title|id=6601082|title=Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles}} {{Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles}} {{Nickelodeon original series and Nicktoons}} {{portal bar|Nickelodeon|Cartoon|Television in the United States|Superhero fiction|2010s}} [[Category:2018 American television series debuts]] [[Category:2010s American animated television series]] [[Category:2010s Nickelodeon shows]] [[Category:2010s American science fiction television series]] [[Category:2010s American children's television series]] [[Category:English-language television programs]] [[Category:American animated television programs featuring anthropomorphic characters]] [[Category:Anime-influenced Western animation]] [[Category:American children's animated action television series]] [[Category:American children's animated adventure television series]] [[Category:American children's animated superhero television series]] [[Category:American children's animated science fantasy television series]] [[Category:American children's animated comedy television series]] [[Category:Television shows set in New York City]] [[Category:Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles television series]] [[Category:American flash animated television series]] [[Category:Animated television series reboots]] [[Category:Nicktoons]]

{{Infobox television | show_name = Strong Girl Bong-soon | image = StrongWomanDoBong-soon_(Main_poster).jpg | caption = Promotional poster | show_name_2 = | genre = {{ubl|[[Fantasy film|Fantasy]]|[[Thriller film|Thriller]]|[[Action film|Action]]|[[Romantic comedy]]}} | writer = Baek Mi-kyung | director = [[Lee Hyung-min]] | starring = {{ubl|[[Park Bo-young]]|[[Park Hyung-sik]]|[[Ji Soo]]}} | theme_music_composer = {{ill|Moon Sung-nam|ko|문성남}} | opentheme = | endtheme = | composer = | country = South Korea | language = [[Korean language|Korean]] | num_episodes = 16 + 1 special | executive_producer = Song Won-sub
Park In-sun | producer = Park Jun-seo
{{ill|Lee Jin-suk|ko|이진석 (연출가)}}
Park Ji-an
Ra Sung-shik | location = | cinematography = Moon Se-hong
Lee Min-jin | editor = Oh Dong-hee | camera = | runtime = 70 minutes | company = {{ill|Drama House|ko|드라마하우스앤드제이콘텐트허브}}
[[JS Pictures]] | distributor = [[JTBC]] | picture_format = [[1080i]] ([[HDTV]]) | audio_format = | first_aired = {{start date|2017|2|24}} | last_aired = {{end date|2017|4|15}} | website = http://tv.jtbc.joins.com/dobongsoon | production_website = http://jspictures.tv/portfolio_page/힘쎈여자-도봉순/ | channel = [[JTBC]] }} '''''Strong Girl Bong-soon'''''{{cite web|url=http://www.jtbcworldwide.com/script/detail?pgmMstSeq=204|title=Strong Girl Bong-soon|website=JTBC Worldwide|publisher=JTBC Content Hub|accessdate=February 10, 2018}} ({{ko-hhrm|힘쎈여자 도봉순||Himssenyeoja Do Bong-sun|lit='''''Strong Woman Do Bong-soon'''''}}) is a 2017 [[Korean drama|South Korean television series]] starring [[Park Bo-young]] in the title role as a woman with superhuman strength, with [[Park Hyung-sik]] and [[Ji Soo]]. It aired every Friday and Saturday on [[JTBC]] starting from February 24, 2017, to April 15, 2017.{{cite web|last1=Jo|first1=He-rim|title=[V Report] Park Bo-young wears toy crown, thanks fans|url=http://kpopherald.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=201608101033527128162_2|website=Kpop Herald|publisher=Herald Corporation|accessdate=October 3, 2016}}{{cite web|last1=Park|first1=Hyeon-min|title=[단독] 박형식, 차기작 '도봉순' 확정…박보영과 첫 호흡|url=http://entertain.naver.com/ranking/read?oid=109&aid=0003402874|website=Naver|publisher=OSEN|accessdate=October 3, 2016|language=ko}}{{cite web|last1=Myeong|first1=Hee-sook|title=JTBC·박형식 양측 "'도봉순' 확정, 내년 편성 예정"(공식입장)|url=http://news1.kr/articles/?2788035|website=News1 News|publisher=News1 Korea|accessdate=October 3, 2016|language=ko}}{{Cite news|last1=Myung|first1=Hee-sook|url=http://news1.kr/articles/?2681890|title=JTBC 측 "박보영, '힘쎈여자 도봉순' 주연 긍정 검토 중"(공식입장)|website=News1 News|publisher=New1 Korea|accessdate=December 12, 2016|language=ko}} The series was a commercial hit and became one of the [[Korean drama#List of highest-rated Korean dramas in cable television|highest rated Korean dramas in cable television history]].{{cite web|last1=Park|first1=Jin-young|title=[美친시청률] '도봉순' 로맨스 타고 시청률 또 터졌다..9.66% 새 기록|url=http://entertain.naver.com/read?oid=109&aid=0003503749|website=Naver|publisher=Osen|accessdate=October 10, 2017|language=ko}}{{cite web|last1=Jie|first1=Ye-eun|title='Strong Woman Do Bong-soon' ends with JTBC's top viewership|url=http://kpopherald.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=201704161733316724032_2|website=Kpop Herald|publisher=Herald Corporation|accessdate=October 10, 2017}} ==Synopsis== Do Bong-soon ([[Park Bo-young]]) was born with superhuman strength. Her strength is hereditary and passed along only to the women in her family. Her dream is to create a video game with herself as the main character. She desperately wants to become a willowy and elegant woman, which is the ideal type of her crush, In Guk-doo ([[Ji Soo]]), a police officer. Thanks to her strength, she gets the job of a bodyguard to a rich heir Ahn Min-hyuk ([[Park Hyung-sik]]), the CEO of a gaming company, Ainsoft. Contrary to Guk-doo, Min-hyuk is an odd man who is playful, a little spoiled, has no regard for rules, and dislikes policemen. He has recently received anonymous threats, blackmails, and has even been stalked at an occasion. One day, a series of kidnapping cases break in Dobong-dong, the district Bong-soon lives in, and she is determined to catch the culprit after her friend was targeted. With the help and training from Min-hyuk, she manages to control her strength to use it for good causes. Min-hyuk and Bong-soon find themselves and their relationship grew into something more. ==Cast== ===Main=== *[[Park Bo-young]] as Do Bong-soon{{Cite web|last1=Yoon|first1=Ga-yi|url=http://media.daum.net/entertain/drama/newsview?newsid=20160603133010138|title=[단독]박보영 JTBC '힘쎈여자 도봉순' 원톱 주연 낙점|website=Daum|publisher=Newsen|accessdate=December 12, 2016|language=ko}} **Go Na-hee as young Do Bong-soon :A young woman born with superhuman strength who tries to use her powers for good. *[[Park Hyung-sik]] as Ahn Min-hyuk{{Cite news|last1=Seon|first1=Soo-mi|url=http://entertain.naver.com/read?oid=404&aid=0000155710|title='뽀블리' 박보영, '힘센 여자 도봉순' 괴력 만렙녀로 컴백|website=Naver|publisher=E News 24|accessdate=December 12,
